text.div:
Generated Narrative: CodeSystem gridhamd-answer-options-cs

This code system http://example.org/fhir/CodeSystem/gridhamd-answer-options-cs defines the following codes:

CodeDisplay
Q1-1 Absent and Absent or clinically insignificant
Q1-2 Mild (Feelings of sadness, discouragement, low selfesteem, pessimism) and Absent or clinically insignificant
Q1-3 Mild (Feelings of sadness, discouragement, low selfesteem, pessimism) and Occasional
Q1-4 Mild (Feelings of sadness, discouragement, low selfesteem, pessimism) and Much of the time
Q1-5 Mild (Feelings of sadness, discouragement, low selfesteem, pessimism) and Almost all the time
Q1-6 Moderate (Clear nonverbal signs of sadness, feelings of hopelessness, helplessness, or worthlessness about some aspects of life) and Occasional
Q1-7 Moderate (Clear nonverbal signs of sadness, feelings of hopelessness, helplessness, or worthlessness about some aspects of life) and Much of the time
Q1-8 Moderate (Clear nonverbal signs of sadness, feelings of hopelessness, helplessness, or worthlessness about some aspects of life) and Almost all the time
Q1-9 Severe (Intense sadness, hopelessness about most aspects of life, feelings of complete helplessness or worthlessness) and Occasional
Q1-10 Severe (Intense sadness, hopelessness about most aspects of life, feelings of complete helplessness or worthlessness) and Much of the time
Q1-11 Severe (Intense sadness, hopelessness about most aspects of life, feelings of complete helplessness or worthlessness) and almost all of the time
Q1-12 Very severe (Extreme sadness; intractable hopelessness or helplessness) and Occasional
Q1-13 Very severe (Extreme sadness; intractable hopelessness or helplessness) and Much off the time
Q1-14 Very severe (Extreme sadness; intractable hopelessness or helplessness) and Almost all of the time
Q2-1 Absent and Absent or clinically insignificant
Q2-2 Mild (Feelings of sadness, discouragement, low selfesteem, pessimism) and Absent or clinically insignificant
Q2-3 Mild (Self-critical, self-reproach, e.g., “I’ve letpeople down”) and Occasional
Q2-4 Mild (Self-critical, self-reproach, e.g., “I’ve letpeople down”) and Much of the time
Q2-5 Mild (Self-critical, self-reproach, e.g., “I’ve letpeople down”) and Almost all the time
Q2-6 Moderate (Feelings of guilt, remorse, shame; belief that one has done something bad or wrong) and Occasional
Q2-7 Moderate (Feelings of guilt, remorse, shame; belief that one has done something bad or wrong) and Much of the time
Q2-8 Moderate (Feelings of guilt, remorse, shame; belief that one has done something bad or wrong) and Almost all the time
Q2-9 Severe (Pervasive feelings of guilt; feels the illness is a punishment for sinful deeds) and Occasional
Q2-10 Severe (Pervasive feelings of guilt; feels the illness is a punishment for sinful deeds) and Much of the time
Q2-11 Severe (Pervasive feelings of guilt; feels the illness is a punishment for sinful deeds) and almost all of the time
Q2-12 Very Severe (Delusions, hallucinations) and Much off the time
Q2-13 Very Severe (Delusions, hallucinations) and Almost all of the time
Q3-1 Absent and Absent or clinically insignificant
Q3-2 Mild (Feels life is not worth living, but expresses no wish to die, e.g., “I don’t care if I live or die”) and Absent or clinically insignificant
Q3-3 Mild (Feels life is not worth living, but expresses no wish to die, e.g., “I don’t care if I live or die”) and Occasional
Q3-4 Mild (Feels life is not worth living, but expresses no wish to die, e.g., “I don’t care if I live or die”) and Much of the time
Q3-5 Mild (Feels life is not worth living, but expresses nowish to die, e.g., “I don’t care if I live or die”) and Almost all the time
Q3-6 Moderate (Wishes to be dead; thoughts of dying, but no specific plan or intent, e.g., “If I got hit by a bus, I wouldn’t care,” “I’d like to go to sleep and never wake up”) and Occasional
Q3-7 Moderate (Wishes to be dead; thoughts of dying, but no specific plan or intent, e.g., “If I got hit by a bus, I wouldn’t care,” “I’d like to go to sleep and never wake up”) and Much of the time
Q3-8 Moderate (Wishes to be dead; thoughts of dying, but no specific plan or intent, e.g., “If I got hit by a bus, I wouldn’t care,” “I’d like to go to sleep and never wake up”) and Almost all the time
Q3-9 Severe (Clear suicidal plan or intent; suicidal gesture, e.g., taking a few sleeping pills) and Occasional
Q3-10 Severe (Clear suicidal plan or intent; suicidal gesture, e.g., taking a few sleeping pills) and Much of the time
Q3-11 Severe (Clear suicidal plan or intent; suicidal gesture, e.g., taking a few sleeping pills) and almost all of the time
Q3-12 Very severe (Attempts at suicide) and Occasional
Q3-13 Very severe (Attempts at suicide) and Much off the time
Q3-14 Very severe (Attempts at suicide) and Almost all of the time
Q4-1 Absent and Absent or clinically insignificant
Q4-2 Mild (30 – 59 minutes to fall asleep) and Absent or clinically insignificant
Q4-3 Mild (30 – 59 minutes to fall asleep) and Occasional
Q4-4 Mild (30 – 59 minutes to fall asleep) and Much of the time
Q4-5 Mild (30 – 59 minutes to fall asleep) and Almost all the time
Q4-6 Marked (1 hour or more to fall asleep) and Occasional
Q4-7 Marked (1 hour or more to fall asleep) and Much of the time
Q4-8 Marked (1 hour or more to fall asleep) and Almost all the time
Q5-1 Absent and Absent or clinically insignificant
Q5-2 Mild (30 – 59 minutes awake) and Absent or clinically insignificant

Q5-7 Marked (1 hour or more awake) and Much of the time
Q5-8 Marked (1 hour or more awake) and Almost all the time
Q6-1 Absent and Absent or clinically insignificant

Q6-7 Marked (1 hour or more awake) and Much of the time
Q6-8 Marked (1 hour or more awake) and Almost all the time
Q7-1 Absent and Absent or clinically insignificant
Q7-2 Mild (Some reduction in interest or pleasure but no clear impairment in functioning) and Absent or clinically insignificant
Q7-3 Mild (Some reduction in interest or pleasure but no clear impairment in functioning) and Occasional
Q7-4 Mild (Some reduction in interest or pleasure but no clear impairment in functioning) and Much of the time
Q7-5 Mild (Some reduction in interest or pleasure but no clear impairment in functioning) and Almost all the time
Q7-6 Moderate (Significant reduction in interest or pleasure or clear impairment in functioning) and Occasional
Q7-7 Moderate (Significant reduction in interest or pleasure or clear impairment in functioning) and Much of the time
Q7-8 Moderate (Significant reduction in interest or pleasure or clear impairment in functioning) and Almost all the time
Q7-9 Severe (Profound reduction in interest, pleasure, and functioning) and Occasional
Q7-10 Severe (Profound reduction in interest, pleasure, and functioning) and Much of the time
Q7-11 Severe (Profound reduction in interest, pleasure, and functioning) and almost all of the time
Q7-12 Very Severe (Unable to work; needs help performing self-care activities; unable to function without assistance) and Occasional
Q7-13 Very Severe (Unable to work; needs help performing self-care activities; unable to function withoutassistance) and Much off the time
Q7-14 Very Severe (Unable to work; needs help performing self-care activities; unable to function without assistance) and Almost all of the time
Q8-1 Absent
Q8-2 Mild (Rate of speech slightly reduced)
Q8-3 Moderate (Rate of speech clearly reduced with noticeable pauses)
Q8-4 Severe (Interview clearly prolonged due to long breaks; all movements very slowed)
Q8-5 Very Severe (Interview cannot be completed, unresponsive)
Q9-1 Absent (movements within normal range, e.g., occasionally shifts position in seat)
Q9-2 Mild (Doubtful or slight agitation, mild restlessness,e.g., frequently changing position in seat, foottapping, playing with hair, hands, or clothes)
Q9-3 Moderate (Moderate to marked restlessness or agitation, e.g., wringing hands, excessive scratching or picking)
Q9-4 Severe (Cannot sit still or stay seated even for a short period of time; pacing)
Q9-5 Very Severe (Interview cannot be conducted)
Q10-1 Absent and Absent or clinically insignificant
Q10-2 Mild (some feelings of worry or irritability) and Absent or clinically insignificant
Q10-3 Mild (some feelings of worry or irritability) and Occasional
Q10-4 Mild (some feelings of worry or irritability) and Much of the time
Q10-5 Mild (some feelings of worry or irritability) and Almost all the time
Q10-6 Moderate (excessive worry or irritability; anxiety causes distress; may cause some impairment in functioning) and Occasional
Q10-7 Moderate (excessive worry or irritability; anxiety causes distress; may cause some impairment in functioning) and Much of the time
Q10-8 Moderate (excessive worry or irritability; anxiety causes distress; may cause some impairment in functioning) and Almost all the time
Q10-9 Severe (pervasive worry or dread; fearing the worst; apprehension obvious in demeanor or behavior; significant impairment in functioning; feelings of panic) and Occasional
Q10-10 Severe (pervasive worry or dread; fearing the worst; apprehension obvious in demeanor or behavior; significant impairment in functioning; feelings of panic) and Much of the time
Q10-11 Severe (pervasive worry or dread; fearing the worst; apprehension obvious in demeanor or behavior; significant impairment in functioning; feelings of panic) and almost all of the time
Q10-12 Very Severe (incapacitating) and Occasional
Q10-13 Very Severe (incapacitating) and Much off the time
Q10-14 Very Severe (incapacitating) and Almost all of the time
Q11-1 Absent and Absent or clinically insignificant
Q11-2 Mild (some distress) and Absent or clinically insignificant
Q11-3 Mild (some distress) and Occasional
Q11-4 Mild (some distress) and Much of the time
Q11-5 Mild (some distress) and Almost all the time
Q11-6 Moderate (marked distress, may cause some impairment in functioning) and Occasional
Q11-7 Moderate (marked distress, may cause some impairment in functioning) and Much of the time
Q11-8 Moderate (marked distress, may cause some impairment in functioning) and Almost all the time
Q11-9 Severe (significant impairment in functioning) and Occasional
Q11-10 Severe (significant impairment in functioning) and Much of the time
Q11-11 Severe (significant impairment in functioning) and almost all of the time
Q11-12 Very Severe (incapacitating) and Occasional
Q11-13 Very Severe (incapacitating) and Much off the time
Q11-14 Very Severe (incapacitating) and Almost all of the time
Q12-1 Absent and Absent or clinically insignificant
Q12-2 Mild (Some loss of appetite but eating without encouragement; less interest or pleasure in eating) and Absent or clinically insignificant
Q12-3 Mild (Some loss of appetite but eating without encouragement; less interest or pleasure in eating) and Occasional
Q12-4 Mild (Some loss of appetite but eating without encouragement; less interest or pleasure in eating) and Much of the time
Q12-5 Mild (Some loss of appetite but eating without encouragement; less interest or pleasure in eating)and Almost all the time
Q12-6 Marked (Marked loss of appetite, very little interest or pleasure in eating (e.g., forcing self to eat)) and Occasional
Q12-7 Marked (Marked loss of appetite, very little interest or pleasure in eating (e.g., forcing self to eat)) and Much of the time
Q12-8 Marked (Marked loss of appetite, very little interest or pleasure in eating (e.g., forcing self to eat)) and Almost all the time
Q13-1 Absent and Absent or clinically insignificant
Q13-2 Mild (mild tiredness, loss of energy, fatigue, feelings of heaviness in limbs or being weighted down, or muscular aches or pains) and Absent or clinically insignificant
Q13-3 Mild (mild tiredness, loss of energy, fatigue, feelings of heaviness in limbs or being weighted down, or muscular aches or pains) and Occasional
Q13-4 Mild (mild tiredness, loss of energy, fatigue, feelings of heaviness in limbs or being weighted down, or muscular aches or pains) and Much of the time
Q13-5 Mild (mild tiredness, loss of energy, fatigue, feelings of heaviness in limbs or being weighted down, or muscular aches or pains) and Almost all the time
Q13-6 Marked (prominent tiredness, loss of energy, fatigue, feelings of heaviness in limbs or being weighted down, or muscular aches or pains) and Occasional
Q13-7 Marked (prominent tiredness, loss of energy, fatigue, feelings of heaviness in limbs or being weighted down, or muscular aches or pains)and Much of the time
Q13-8 Marked (prominent tiredness, loss of energy, fatigue, feelings of heaviness in limbs or being weighted down, or muscular aches or pains) and Almost all the time
Q14-1 Absent
Q14-2 Mild (Some loss of interest or pleasure)
Q14-3 Marked (Marked loss of interest or pleasure)
Q15-1 Absent and Absent or clinically insignificant
Q15-2 Mild (preoccupation with bodily functions and sensations, but no concerns about a specific illness) and Absent or clinically insignificant
Q15-3 Mild (preoccupation with bodily functions and sensations, but no concerns about a specific illness) and Occasional
Q15-4 Mild (preoccupation with bodily functions and sensations, but no concerns about a specific illness) and Much of the time
Q15-5 Mild (preoccupation with bodily functions and sensations, but no concerns about a specific illness) and Almost all the time
Q15-6 Moderate (Excessive or unrealistic worry about having an illness, e.g., “I worry that these headaches are from a brain tumor.”) and Occasional
Q15-7 Moderate (Excessive or unrealistic worry about having an illness, e.g., “I worry that these headaches are from a brain tumor.”) and Much of the time
Q15-8 Moderate (Excessive or unrealistic worry about having an illness, e.g., “I worry that these headaches are from a brain tumor.”) and Almost all the time
Q15-9 Severe (Strong unrealistic conviction of having an illness, e.g., “I am convinced I have cancer”) and Occasional
Q15-10 Severe (Strong unrealistic conviction of having an illness, e.g., “I am convinced I have cancer”) and Much of the time
Q15-11 Severe (Strong unrealistic conviction of having an illness, e.g., “I am convinced I have cancer”) and almost all of the time
Q15-12 Very Severe (Somatic delusions or hallucinations, e.g., “My insides are rotting”) and Occasional
Q15-13 Very Severe (Somatic delusions or hallucinations, e.g., “My insides are rotting”) and Much off the time
Q15-14 Very Severe (Somatic delusions or hallucinations, e.g., “My insides are rotting”) and Almost all of the time
Q16/1-1 No weight loss
Q16/1-2 Probable weight loss
Q16/1-3 Definite weight loss
Q16/2-1 Less than 1 lb. (.5 kg) loss per week since last visit
Q16/2-2 1-2 lb. (.5 – 1 kg) loss per week since last visit
Q16/2-3 More than 2-lb (> 1 kg) loss per week since last visit
Q17-1 Any recognition of depressive symptoms, with or without attribution to any cause, e.g., “I’m depressed because my partner always argues with me.
Q17-2 Denies illness but accepts possibility of being ill, e.g., “I don’t think there’s anything wrong, but other people think there is.
Q17-3 Complete denial of having any illness, e.g., “I’m not depressed; I’m fine.
